channel.title: Contributing to Simula Github space on Code@Simula
channel.description: Recent content in Contributing to Simula Github space on Code@Simula

item.title: Documentation
item.description: Documentation is important because this is the only source of information (except the code itself), that the user has. You should write enough documentation so that any person could install and run your code. Your documentation should contain at least the following Installation instructions How to install the code Installation requirementes Put this in your README file Documentation of code In your code you should put docstrings that explains what the different functions are doing.

item.title: Guidelines
item.description: Here you will find some general guidelines for what you should make sure that your code contains before you put in on the Simula Github space.

item.title: Testing
item.description: Write about testing, continous integration etc

item.title: For python developers
item.description: You should strive to follow the PEP8 style
